website_summaries.verdict: If you want a breathable tree wrap that will degrade over time, this product is a great choice.
pros: Considering the price you'll pay, this white tree wrap is a great value
Protects tree bark from insects and stray trimmer blades and string
Over time, the wrap will degrade, allowing the tree and bark to continue to grow normally
cons: Very thin wrap that may not adhere well to the tree

customer_reviews.title: Stop the ants on Fruit Trees.
customer_reviews.text: I looked all over for the 'White Wrap' on fruit trees to help protect from ants. When I found this and the Bug Barrier gel, I was glad to try. Works great. I have wrapped my peach and plum trees in minutes. Cannot believe the ants caught on the wrap. The peaches are now growing very fast. I will be buying more each summer.
customer_reviews.author: Benita Silvestri

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrates Over Time - Falls Off
customer_reviews.text: I've treated a few trees with this wrap in Arizona. Although mostly protected from the sun, this wrap would disintegrate over the course of 9-12 months. Because it's made of plastic, it would dry up and literally fall apart. We first noticed small white pieces on the ground. Further inspection showed the wrap was coming off due to it eroding from the sun/heat. We try not to use things made of plastic in the outdoor AZ sun for this exact reason. I should have noticed the "made of polypropylene fabric" in the description. The brown paper type wrap we used on the same trees lasted much longer, held up much better.
customer_reviews.author: Rogo

customer_reviews.title: Good product- easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and easy to use. Slight amount of stretchiness aides installation. I had enough for about 12' of 1.5 inch trunk. Prior experience indicates this product will fail due to tree circumference increase rather than weather degradation.
customer_reviews.author: DAC

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: This worked very quickly. I used this along with Tanglefoot Tree Insect Barrier. I wrapped the tree wrap around the tree twice. Then I tied a strip of the tree wrap around that to keep it in place and make it tight against the tree trunk. The wrap and the Tanglefoot immediately kept the Argentine Ants from going up and down the tree trunk. I have a mealybug infestation in my grapefruit tree and this is step one to curing it.
customer_reviews.author: Cleaningoutmyclosets

customer_reviews.title: Saved our maple tree!
customer_reviews.text: Our horses ate so much of the bark all around the trunk of our maple tree that it looked like it was going to die. We painted the Tanglefoot Tree Wound Pruning Sealer & Grafting Compound on the bare portions and wrapped the trunk with the Tree Wrap. It looks so beautiful now.
customer_reviews.author: Linda E.

customer_reviews.title: Use this on all my trees
customer_reviews.text: These wraps are fantastic for the crazy Colorado winter weather. I started using the wrap 4 years ago on our fragile peach tree and some other random trees we purchased online and I honestly think that, because they were wrapped, all of the trees flruished when spring came around. The peach tree just produced about 1500 peaches this year and must have shot up to 20 feet high. Now that we've moved and got brand new trees, I am wrapping them all over again for the winter. Fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good width, required pressure to apply and adhsive to hold end in place
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use with tanglefoot for my fruit trees. It is a good width at 3 inches but it requires a fair amount of pressure when wrapping to contour to the base, which is needed to ensure ants and other pests can't get past/underneath the barrier. Also, it has no mechanism for self-adherence and required tape to keep the end in place before applying the tanglefoot. Once applied (as noted with pressure and adhesive end), it did the job of holding the tanglefoot in place, which has captured ants, flying insects, and other crawly things, allowing my fruit trees to thrive without infestation!
customer_reviews.author: GoingGalt122

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it is intended for--safely
customer_reviews.text: Wrapped my young tree trunk with this, cut the end, and tied a knot to protect my young tree from sunscorch. Loosened the knot a bit to give the trunk breathing room, which was easy. So far (it's been 3 months at least), the wrap has been durable and is a safe, breathable/stretchable fabric-y mesh. Just make sure you leave a little space/loose knot for breathability. Very pleased with it and wold buy again. No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Beasly

customer_reviews.title: My arborist loved it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to protect a young tree. It was easy to install and it is doing a great job. My arborist was in the neighborhood and saw it and stopped by to ask me about it. He had never seen a trre wrap in White. He said it would do a better job than all the other tree wraps he had seen. Will buy agin if needed- It is a great purchsae.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Goodie

customer_reviews.title: Great for fending off deer and cat claws
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Not only does it keep the deer from chewing on the bark, it acts as a buffer against my cat’s claws on the tree trunk. This product does not adhere to the tree or itself. You just need to overlap the fabric. I use this year round and replace twice a year to allow the tree to expand. Holds up very well from one replacement cycle to the next.
customer_reviews.author: Tilly

customer_reviews.title: TCB my Jasmine with Dewitt Tree Wrap!
customer_reviews.text: I like this wrap. I did the base of 3 of my Carolina Jasmine because they are being attacked by bugs and now I feel like I have given them an extra layer of protection. I gave a 5 to easy to use which is funny because it really wasn't easy to get everything sufficiently wrapped. I laid on the ground for over an hour. But the tree wrap was easy to use in the process. Also, I secured the wrap with zip ties since the project was so small-scale. Now I can spray the wrap with Neem oil.
customer_reviews.author: Ddmck

customer_reviews.title: great sun scald protection
customer_reviews.text: This is often on sale under 4$ and for that price it is a great value. I bought this to protect my small fruit trees against sun scald. I normally paint the trunks for this purpose but for the front yard trees I wanted something that I could take off after winter to keep the trees looking nice. This worked perfectly and each piece is in great shape after winter so I can reuse those pieces again next winter. They are a soft and breathable fabric but strong and sturdy enough to stay in place if you loop the end at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L.

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting protection
customer_reviews.text: I bought two rolls to wrap 8 oak trees that I planted late summer. I wrapped from the base to the first branch and tied it at the top by running back through the last loop one time. There is a significant amount of wind in this area and the wrap has stayed tight on all 8 trees despite significant rainfall and wind. I would absolutely buy this again for any tree that I plan in the future.
customer_reviews.author: dakota

customer_reviews.title: Very good wrap that does not have any adhesive - better for the tree
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice tree wrap. One important thing to know - this product does not have adhesive to stick to the tree, which is better for the long-term health of the tree. When I bought it I wasn't sure what to expect since the description was not clear. With that being said, the wrap is thick enough to stand up to the elements, and I found that two layers of wrap was plenty of coverage for the tree I was protecting. It does exactly what is says, and will give the tree protection while keeping air flowing to the tree trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on three newly planted Aspen trees last fall, we have lots of snow here in Idaho and lots of deer and elk on our property. Though the deer and elk managed to prune off a few low hanging branches, they didn't ever go for the bark, and the tape also kept the bark from splitting. Really simple to use, and if it succeeded in getting my new trees through the winter, well worth the little money put out.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad (updated review)
customer_reviews.text: It's not as flexible or stretchy as some other, similar wrap I've used but it goes on fairly well. Time will tell. The price was reasonable. Some of this has been on the trees for over a year now and it's still hanging on. A little buck rub, a little mower graze... still good. If it had a little stretch to it I'd give it 5 stars... without stretch it's a tad clumsy to apply. Solid product!
customer_reviews.author: amphibiac

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but hard to stay put
customer_reviews.text: We have sunburn on our trees and were worried about the coming heat in CA. This seems like regular gauze and its not that stretchy. It was kind of slippery and hard to stay put. I'm not sure how its supposed to stay stuck together but we have had to redo the wrap twice in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shieh

customer_reviews.title: Substantial tree bandage
customer_reviews.text: We used the Dewitt tree wrap as a laminate with some Trekote sealant. By cutting the wrap material into specific lengths, we we’re able to mesh it onto the sizable tree wound. The tree wrap provided a very stable substrate for the sealant to blend with and the tree wound is now completely sealed, and safe from insects.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great product to protect trees!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this product on Youtube, pertaining to saving plants from heat and I bought it immediately. It is super easy to use, and wrapped well around my trees! I am really glad I found this product verses using the paint.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi H.

customer_reviews.title: We will see
customer_reviews.text: My husband wrapped our two citrus trees with this wrap a few days ago. We will see how well it holds up at 100+ degrees for the summer. Fortunately we have quite a bit of the wrap left if we need to reinforce the tree trunks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like a bandage for your tree
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting that crinkly brown stuff. This stuff is more like gauze. White and like a bandage. It’s like a cleaning towel you pull from a dispenser. Wrapped my trees the same day. Doesn’t stick to itself so you have to use tape. Can’t talk about durability for a few mows or months.
customer_reviews.author: Eriamjh

customer_reviews.title: This works great
customer_reviews.text: I want my trees to live in the cold winters. I wrap them each fall before snow. My neighbor wrapped his in the plastic flexible type wrap and when spring came around the entire gap between the plastic and the tree bark was loaded w/ bugs. I'll stick w/ the dewett tree wrap because it works.
customer_reviews.author: SE Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Good product for protecting young tree bark from the sun.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected. I use it, however, only to protect a sapling's bark from the summer sun. Other uses I can't speak to, except to say this isn't a product intended to protect a tree from trimmers or other impact (even though the label says wrapping multiple layers will do so). It's thinner than an ace bandage. And that's just right for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Good tree wrap
customer_reviews.text: We have a damaged tree and an arborist recommended wrapping it in the winter for protection. We usually buy a different brand tree wrap but the price of it doubled. The Dewitt wrap is a decent wrap. It is a great value (longer than most) at a great price. Only four stars as it is a little thinner material than what we usually use.
customer_reviews.author: Lanatec

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: This was very thin and didn't appear to be durable. The good stuff lasts for a couple years, but this thin stuff will shatter and blow off in the first wind storm....I returned it. Also arrived dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Denni

customer_reviews.title: Worked on a Blaze Maple with a trunk injury
customer_reviews.text: used it on the base of a blaze maple that developed sun scald on the trunk on the south side. Tree is healing, we are using this to protect and close the wound against insects and sun.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: way better than paper tree wraps
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to wrap than the paper tree wraps. Although not as thick as the paper wraps, seems to hold in place much better. Still need something to hold in place at beginning and end (I used white gorilla tape). Like reflective value of this wrap. Should work well this winter to protect from sun scald.
customer_reviews.author: fishinbug

customer_reviews.title: So far, nice tree protection!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to wrap a new free tree I received. Its still young and thin so I was worried how it would make it through a Michigan winter. I used this product to wrap it up for protection (winter sweater). We had our first snow storm yesterday and it stood strong, so far - whew whew. I will wait until spring to see the end result (will update my post then).
customer_reviews.author: Clair

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: No way to seal this on the tree...was hoping it was sticky or would somehow adhere itself to the tree. Not sure what they expect me to do? Use tape?
customer_reviews.author: Diana F

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: The tree wrap was fine, but did not cover all of what I wanted it to. This is not the products fault. Next time I will get 75 feet or two rolls of 50 feet. The difficulty arose because the base of the tree was wider than I thought and wrapping several times took up a lot of wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Metallurgist

customer_reviews.title: Goid product
customer_reviews.text: I wrapped the trunk of a ash tree,the material was stro g and it should last thru the az summer,the only problem is amazon drivers never ring the door bell ,so you have to check often so that your package doest get taken by thieves
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: A life saver
customer_reviews.text: It lasted all summer here where our temps (Phoenix) can be real damaging to trees. My ash tree was not doing too great at the start of the summer and was getting baked on the west side of the tree every day. I got the wrap on and it has lasted really well, helped keep the young tree alive!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Have used this previously and works great. Holds up against our coldest winters and keeps the critters at bay!
customer_reviews.author: Northland Squatter

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I have a coral tree that keeps sprouting branches from the trunk. I keep pruning them off to try to force the tree to grow up rather than turn into a bush. I wrapped the trunk with this wrap to try to prevent future sprouts. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Buttman

customer_reviews.title: Deer rubbing our trees!
customer_reviews.text: We have deer that frequent our property and they started rubbing and chewing on our newly planted Quaking Aspen trees. We wrapped every tree from the base to about 1/2 up and it seems to be keeping the deer away! It's super easy to wrap too. No tape or ties needed!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney K.

customer_reviews.title: Protecting our new Catulpa trees.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to apply to trunk of the trees. I chose white to help cool the bark under the wrap. The dark colors would be too hot in our climate. I know these will also protect from sun-scald in the winter. So far, so good. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: C. G.

customer_reviews.title: Protect your trees with this wrap.
customer_reviews.text: Why is this stuff so hard to find? My local home improvement stores dont carry tree wrap, so I turned to Amazon. I planted three young trees about 1" in diameter and used this wrap in to cover the truck and protect the bark. I applied it in April and it's still holding strong. No damage from the terrible ground squirrels that have attacked other plants.
customer_reviews.author: GorgonGirl

customer_reviews.title: Tree wrap, or 'it's a wrap'.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install by yourself but two would probably make the application look more even. First season of application so don't know its durability but as long as it blocks the sun and protects my tree I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Roy E Bean Jr

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on our new sapling  maple
customer_reviews.text: Wrap went on fine without any issues. Seems like it will be durable enough to last a couple of years at least.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Wrapped nicely.
customer_reviews.text: A little more stretchy would be helpful. Hopefully will hold up for years. I use it to: keep trunk from sprouting keep ants off - do not need an ant fungus farm in the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Lorin M.

customer_reviews.title: Used With Wound Care
customer_reviews.text: Used this with wound care and it saved one of our cherry trees, realy easy and simple to use
customer_reviews.author: Draven

customer_reviews.title: Tree wrap which does the job at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Its tree wrap, plain and simple, no more or less at a reasonable price. I wish it came in black so it didn't stand out so much. you can wrap 3-5 10-20 ft tall trees with one roll depending on the thickness of the trunk and how far up you go from the ground which for me is typically 3-4 ft.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not as it should be
customer_reviews.text: This did not stick on tree like it was supposed to. I had to use tape over the product to hold it to tree 😑
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product as described
customer_reviews.text: This has helped my tree, but nothing can truly protect from the southeast Texas sun! Hoping to get through the summer without my tree dying.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Does the job better than paper wraps
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply. Stays put. Kept the rabbits away. Worked much better than paper wraps. Will stretch a little so won’t damage the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Gmfell

customer_reviews.title: Good to help prevent weed wacker damage as well as weather damage to your trees
customer_reviews.text: Used to help prevent weed wacker marks and damage into the trunk. Of the trees
customer_reviews.author: Tracylynn McGarvey

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product for tree wrapping. It lasts very long especially in the hot Arizona climate. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection
customer_reviews.text: I got this to protect a very young tree that neighborhood cats used to sharpen their claws. I wrapped it and cats seem to leave it alone.
customer_reviews.author: David Bagby

customer_reviews.title: Great wrap
customer_reviews.text: Easy to wrap my six young trees with this wrap it also lasts for a season 😊
customer_reviews.author: Clura

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wrap tree trunk
customer_reviews.text: Easy to wrap tree trunks and is holding up well so far. Seems effective in blocking the sun from burning the bark.
customer_reviews.author: MuManChu

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, very durable. Protect my fruit trees from sun burns.
customer_reviews.author: toolegit

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I don't know long the wrap will last, or if it helps my trees at all, but it was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: TKH

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: This tree wrap was just super. It was easy to use and thicker than others I have tried. It was easy to wrap and cut without a struggle. Will use again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Salligirl

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I used this wrap on a Maple that got some Sun damage last winter. In an effort to not create more damage this winter. I wrapped the Maple with this. So far, it's held up and I have no concerns about it making it through the winter. Fair price, buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gerads

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to protest a small hydrangea tree that a woodpecker was destroying. I wrapped the trunk & has been successful. The wrap has stayed on through rain & wind. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Deer Guards for Young Trees and Shrubs
customer_reviews.text: Reduced deer damage to trunks on young trees and shrubs. So far, effective for discouraging deer and has been durable. Inexpensive option to the pricey trunk protectors. It is too light to prevent “weed eater” disease.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Used with Tanglefoot
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a charm...easy to apply the tanglefoot and easy to put on and remove. Stayed put...good value
customer_reviews.author: trinimum

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, wrapped several of my young trees and plenty left. You just need to tuck the end in an be sure to start it by rolling it over itself, they have held in place fine without coming undone.
customer_reviews.author: bel

customer_reviews.title: Wrapped up my trees
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good—this tree wrap has held up through strong winds and rain. I will definitely reorder as necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Dot

customer_reviews.title: This can be used over and over again.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product for the past 10 years. Excellent at protecting younger thin bark trees during the winter. Tried this after listening to a local gardening radio show........one of those tid bits of advice that allowed me to plant more delicate ornamental trees in my yard. My neighbors asked me about this wrap and they have been using it for several years.
customer_reviews.author: utahmike

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I kept damaging a sapling when I was trimming, so I wrapped it in this. It is basically a cloth and not adhesive, but the texture kept if from sliding around the bark as I put it on and I just tucked the last wrap under the previous one like it tells you to. Been on for ~6 months with no problem. It has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bell

customer_reviews.title: Been on the tree for over a year now
customer_reviews.text: No signs of wear after being on the trees in the Colorado UV sun. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Chooch

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff pretty good deal on price
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff a better value than at my local store
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good - went on well
customer_reviews.text: Very good - white, fairly wide, easy to put on - is holding up well. I like to tie a knot at each end, and it was easy to cut/tear up the middle of the end of it to get the 2 tails to tie. Good price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Suebee

customer_reviews.title: Tree Wrap
customer_reviews.text: Easier than other options for protecting the base of your trees. Looks professional when wrapped and a lot less messy than paint
customer_reviews.author: SLU

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Does a fine job in protecting my young fruit trees from sun burn in Phoenix as recommended by Dan from PlantAbundance.
customer_reviews.author: RobT

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I wrapped my trees with it for winter but will not know if it can be reusable until I remove it in the spring or if it stayed on through the winter..
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Tree Wrap
customer_reviews.text: Great price and it will help prevent damage to my trees
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Coy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, for a very inexpensive price!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! Very easy to use to wrap our new trees.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Boren

customer_reviews.title: Nice if you can wait.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product but almost a month to get it from China.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Coelho

customer_reviews.title: Stick with paper
customer_reviews.text: It was too hard to get it on. Paper is much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Minnepeg

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working, trees (very small about 2 feet high) aren't dead after scraped all the bark off. Should be either self-adhesive to itself or come with some method to keep it wrapped around the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good product easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use and seems to be keeping the little creatures from feeding on the bark. I decided to use it on all of my fruit trees.
customer_reviews.author: bookwormser

customer_reviews.title: Good material.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my newly planted tree. Strong material and has held together through all the rain we've been having.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and it saved my trees from the weed wacker. lasts a long time worth the little bit of money
customer_reviews.author: rsb

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This was our second order. It can be reused if you can remember where you stored it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Just What We Needed!
customer_reviews.text: White tape for our delicate Japanese feather leaf red maple. The deer and rabbits were chewing the trunk but this tape worked well to stop that. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: fifi61

customer_reviews.title: Helps prevent frost crack on thin barked trees
customer_reviews.text: It covers a 6 inch diameter tree 4 feet up preventing frost crack, which is more of a cosmetic problem than anything. It also helps prevent damage from all the little critters out there.
customer_reviews.author: ebb

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff. We use this for tying our young ...
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. We use this for tying our young trees to their upright stakes the 1st couple years. Also for protecting the tree bark from the neighborhood deer.
customer_reviews.author: El Polacko

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: This tree wrap was not what I expected, but it serves its purpose. It was easy to apply, it was just not the quality of wrap that I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Read

customer_reviews.title: To the rescue
customer_reviews.text: Our fruit trees had cracked bark due to the freezing temperatures at night. This is the first time we have wrapped our trees and so far (mid January) it's still holding onto the trunk of the tree and we will let you know in the spring how our tree trunks are doing. Thanks for the fast delivery service!
customer_reviews.author: Ainokea

customer_reviews.title: Keeps trees alive
customer_reviews.text: This wrap keeps the rubbing bucks from harming the barks of our trees, and keeps the nasty voles from eating the lower bark and killing young trees. Holds up to Wyoming's harsh cold winters, extreme winds and wildly fluctuating temperatures. Wraps well without tangling, and best of all has protected my young trees from the heavy killing freezes.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: I bought it to avoid tree trunk damage from weed whacking around my trees and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: This works surprisingly well. I bought it to avoid tree trunk damage from weed whacking around my trees and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Saved my tree
customer_reviews.text: We had a branch break a little and we wrapped it up. so far the tree has survived and is growing leaves. Worked well. It doesn't stick , but it wrapped easily enough and has stayed on for a month so far.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Keep this product in stock
customer_reviews.text: Very good product.Was used for wrapping trunk of flowering trees.
customer_reviews.author: Maria L. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great for covering trees trunks that can get sun damaged .
customer_reviews.text: Needed it for my ash tree sapling. Works great on little or large trees.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: My trees seem to love these
customer_reviews.text: I have protected many trees with these and repurchased for new trees. Seem to work well and protect the trees.
customer_reviews.author: zxylene

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: i wish it was brown instead of white. my tree looks like a mummy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Romanek

customer_reviews.title: Covered a scar on my red maple.
customer_reviews.text: I wrapped a scar on my red maple tree to protect it from weed eaters, etc. I tied it on and it is staying as expected.
customer_reviews.author: squishy

customer_reviews.title: As expected and it works.
customer_reviews.text: Sun-sens bark on my med-sized tree needed protection, an arborist said, This tape gives protection.
customer_reviews.author: Just Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: Keeps unwrapping from tree. I have to reattach it at least weekly.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use simply weave in itself at the top to keep on tree.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon business client

customer_reviews.title: Could be stronger
customer_reviews.text: A bit thin - could be thicker. Not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Len G

customer_reviews.title: Good for winter protection
customer_reviews.text: Product as described. Will help protect my trees through the harsh winters in Wisconsin.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca V

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Went on very easy. Seems to be holding up to the snow
customer_reviews.author: Chris Krieg

customer_reviews.title: A good product for protecting tree bark.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to wrap the trunk of a newly planted tree at the request of the person sold us the tree. He explained that the extreme temperature changes that take place during Colorado winters can cause the bark on the trunk to split. One day it could be 60 degrees, the next could be 10 degrees. This wrap helps to prevent the splitting by protecting the bark.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: I wish it weren't white so it blended with the tree trunk and I still don't have a great way to tie it off
customer_reviews.text: It works well, and lasts - I have some thats been on trees for 2 years. I wish it weren't white so it blended with the tree trunk and I still don't have a great way to tie it off .
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: Needed to find something to keep the deer away from ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed to find something to keep the deer away from a new willow as they were rubbing the trunk bare. Had bought other wraps which "suffocated" trees in the past. This one seem to be doing the job right! Thanks1
customer_reviews.author: Natalie S.

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be doing the trick. The brown ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be doing the trick. The brown tree wrap that everyone buys shrinks and expands with the weather change and ends up slipping down and sometimes even tearing. This product seems to stay where we put it and doesn't expand or contract with the weather.
customer_reviews.author: deanna6363

customer_reviews.title: The shipping was fast the customer service was great. I will definitely be back
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly what I needed. The shipping was fast the customer service was great. I will definitely be back.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Hemmings

product_meta.title: Dewitt 3-Inch by 50-Foot Tree Wrap White TW3W
product_meta.description:
Color:WhiteDeWitt Breathable Tree Wrap White 3ftx50ft Dewitt tree wrap is a breathable, non girdling wrap that protects trees from scorching, insects and trimmer damage.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The only product recommended by American Nurseryman Magazine, DeWitt Tree Wrap protects trees from scorching and from trimmer or mower damage. Tree Wrap is made of polypropylene fabric and easily conforms to fit any tree shape or bark texture. Tree Wrap slowly photo degrades to prevent girdling of the tree's trunk.
